column4: RE: My filesystem (ext3) automatically mounts as ready-only after sometime (on ubuntu 7.10) , what do i do
did you run a check on the file system_
yup i did, there was no errors ( I did fsck)
and what is the fstab line for it?
does error forces it to remount as read only?
did you check dmesg for r/w errors?
I did dmesg but I didn't understand if there were any error
but when it mounts as read only for any command it gives I/o error
it's usually pretty obvious of there is an error, usually says something with CRC error etc
is there any way I can show you my dmesg report file
you could do a dmesg > output.txt
it will create a file with the output
just realized i have  a lot of crap in the dmesg myself :)
